importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the latest developments in the MLB postseason were reported.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series between the Toronto Blue Jays and the Los Angeles Dodgers.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The postseason period, culminating in the ALCS and NLCS, leading to the World Series matchup.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have made their first World Series appearance in over 30 years after defeating the Seattle Mariners in a seven-game ALCS.

The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll in baseball, are the most successful franchise in recent years, having won two World Series titles and five National League pennants in the past nine seasons.
The Dodgers have shown dominance in the postseason, including a sweep of the Milwaukee Brewers in the NLCS and a single win over the Philadelphia Phillies in the NLDS.

Shohei Ohtani delivered an extraordinary performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, with three home runs as a batter and 6.1 shutout innings as a pitcher, a moment considered one of the greatest individual games in baseball history.
The Blue Jays overcame a tough ALCS against the Mariners, who had a 2-0 series lead, due to defensive lapses and a late three-run home run by George Springer in Game 7.
The Blue Jays' success in the regular season, including a 94-68 record and a 34-run total in the ALDS against the Yankees, marks a significant turnaround from their 2024 performance.
The Dodgers' bullpen has been a weakness, potentially offering an opening for the Blue Jays to apply pressure in the World Series.
The World Series begins on Friday, October 24, in Toronto, marking the first time the two franchises will face each other in a championship series.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in the American League
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the opposing team in the World Series and have just earned their first trip to the series in over 30 years after defeating the Seattle Mariners in a seven-game ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in the National League
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the primary opponent in the upcoming World Series and have a strong postseason performance, including a sweep of the Brewers and a dominant NLDS win over the Phillies.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic performance in Game 4 of the NLCS with three home runs and 6.1 shutout innings, considered one of the greatest individual games in baseball history.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in the American League
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the Blue Jays' opponent in the ALCS, leading 2-0 before being eliminated in Game 7 due to defensive errors and a late home run by George Springer.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A player for the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer hit a late three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS that ended the Mariners' hopes, marking a pivotal moment in the series.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman provided commentary after the ALCS game, emphasizing the team's resilience and ability to stay close throughout the series.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in the National League
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLDS, with the Dodgers winning just one game.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in the National League
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the NLCS, highlighting the Dodgers' postseason dominance.

namedEntities.name: Pittsburgh Pirates
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A professional baseball team in the National League
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Pirates swept the Dodgers in September, contributing to the Dodgers' regular-season struggles and bullpen instability.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series for the first time in over 30 years after defeating the Seattle Mariners in a seven-game ALCS, marking a significant turnaround from their 2024 performance. The opposing team, the Los Angeles Dodgers, are the most successful franchise in recent years with two World Series titles and five NL pennants, having swept the Milwaukee Brewers and narrowly defeated the Philadelphia Phillies in the postseason. The Dodgers’ postseason dominance is highlighted by Shohei Ohtani's legendary performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, where he delivered three home runs and a 6.1 shutout innings. Despite being the favorites, the Dodgers face a defensive and bullpen challenge, while the Blue Jays' success in the ALCS — including a 34-run explosion against the Yankees — suggests a strong team dynamic. The World Series begins on Friday, October 24, in Toronto, making this a pivotal moment in MLB history.
title: Dodgers and Blue Jays Meet in World Series After ALCS and NLCS Drama
